intro: Coutarea flavescens, commonly known as the yellow balsa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. It is often found in humid, tropical forests and is valued for its ornamental qualities. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered in some areas.
